oracle.pg.common

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.common.Util

  • public class Util
extends Object
    This class contains some useful helper functions. Many of the methods are wrapper functions of what are provided in oracle.spatial.util.Util.

    • Method Detail

      • checkSQLName

        public static String checkSQLName(String string,
                  int maxStringLength)
                           throws SQLException
        Checks for any illegal characters in a SQL name. Only alpha-numeric characters and "_","$","#" are allowed.
        Parameters:
        string - input string
        maxStringLength - maximum length for input string
        Returns:
        string Retruns the string if passes the check
        Throws:
        SQLException - An exception is thrown if the input string contains any illegal characters or exceeds the maximum length

      • compareDates

        public static boolean compareDates(Object o1,
                   Object o2)
        Returns true if two given objects (either a Date object or a String representation of a Date object) are the same.
        Parameters:
        o1 - must be either a Date object or String
        o2 - must be either a Date object or String

        Returns:

      • enquoteLiteral

        public static String enquoteLiteral(Connection conn,
                    String name)
                             throws SQLException
        This method enquotes a literal value. It calls SYS.DBMS_ASSERT.enquoteLiteral function.
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        name - the input literal
        Returns:
        string Retruns the string if passes the check
        Throws:
        SQLException - A SQLexception is thrown if the dbms_assert.qualified_sql_name failed

      • enquoteLiteral

        public static String enquoteLiteral(Connection conn,
                    String literal,
                    int maxLengthAllowed)
                             throws SQLException
        Returns the enquoted literal
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        literal - the input name
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • enquoteNameSQLName

        public static String enquoteNameSQLName(Connection conn,
                        String name)
                                 throws SQLException
        Returns the ENQUOTE_NAME formatted String for the SQL name If the Oracle JDBC is present, use the new OracleStatement.enquoteIdentifier API in the JDK8 JDBC. Otherwise use the DBMS_ASSERT.ENQUOTE_NAME formatted String for the SQL name using "false" for the second parameter (i.e., no capitalization of SQL name). This method is added due to avoid SQL Injection issues.
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        name - the input name
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • enquoteTableName

        public static String enquoteTableName(Connection conn,
                      String tableName)
                               throws SQLException
        Enquotes a table name with or without schema name which is separated by ".". This method also can be used to enquote all column names, including object column names like col.attr1.attr2.attr3 == "COL"."ATTR1"."ATTR2"."ATTR3"
        Parameters:
        conn -
        tableName -
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getMaxLengthAllowed

        public static int getMaxLengthAllowed()

      • getValidatedGraphName

        public static String getValidatedGraphName(Connection conn,
                           String graphName)
                                    throws SQLException
        Returns the validated graph name
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        graphName - the input graph name
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getValidatedGraphName

        public static String getValidatedGraphName(Connection conn,
                           String graphName,
                           int maxLengthAllowed)
                                    throws SQLException
        Returns the validated graph name
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        graphName - the input graph name
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • myCheckName

        public static String myCheckName(String string)
                          throws SQLException
        Checks for any illegal characters in a SQL name. Only alpha-numeric characters and ".", "_","$","#" are allowed.
        Parameters:
        string - input string
        Returns:
        string Retruns the string if passes the check
        Throws:
        SQLException - An exception is thrown if the input string contains any illegal characters or exceeds the maximum length

      • qualifiedSQLName

        public static String qualifiedSQLName(Connection conn,
                      String name)
                               throws SQLException
        Checks if the specified name is a qualified SQL name. It calls SYS.DBMS_ASSERT.qualified_sql_name function.
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        name - the input name
        Returns:
        string Retruns the string if passes the check
        Throws:
        SQLException - A SQLexception is thrown if the dbms_assert.qualified_sql_name failed

      • sanitizeSimpleFileName

        public static String sanitizeSimpleFileName(String fileName)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        do sanity checking to the filename, only allowed characters can appear in the file name
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • simpleSqlNameCheck

        public static String simpleSqlNameCheck(Connection conn,
                        String name)
                                 throws SQLException
        This method returns the result of SYS.DBMS_ASSERT.simple_sql_name function.
        Parameters:
        conn - the database connection
        name - the input literal
        Returns:
        string Retruns the output of DBMS_ASSERT.simple_sql_name if passes the check
        Throws:
        SQLException - A SQLexception is thrown if the dbms_assert.simple_sql_name failed
